title: Tech companies get a reprieve thanks to a reversal from the President on tariffs

title: U.S. FTC chief says prepared to break up big tech firms: Bloomberg
text: U.S. Federal Trade Commission is prepared to break up major technology platforms if necessary by undoing their past mergers, Chairman Joe Simons said on Tuesday in an interview to Bloomberg, as the agency anti-competitive practices in the sector.

title: Trump says he delayed tariffs because of concerns over Christmas shopping season
text: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said that he was delaying some tariffs on Chinese imports ahead of the Christmas season to stem their potential impact on holiday shopping.

title: Trump just blinked, giving China a possible edge in trade war, Jim Chanos and others say
text: Some influential voices on Wall Street are saying that Trump blinked in the latest exchange with China.

title: U.S.-China Trade War Snowballs Toward Worst-Case Scenario
text: Despite the stock market's sudden rally Tuesday on news the United States would delay implenting its promised tariffs on Chinese goods, most investors are becoming used to the idea that relations between the world's two largest economies are likely to become more fraught before they improve.

title: US removes some items from China tariff list, delaying tariffs for others, including cell phones
text: The United States Trade Representative office said Tuesday certain items were being removed from the new China tariff list because of “health, safety, national security and other factors” while tariffs on other items would be delayed until December 15.

title: Stock market turns higher in early Tuesday trade as Wall Street attempts to halt multiday skid
text: U.S. stock markets on Tuesday opened modestly higher as investors wrestled with trade wars and political clashes in Hong Kong and worries about Sino-American trade.

title: U.S. inflation accelerates; Fed rate cut still expected
text: U.S. consumer prices increased broadly in July, but the signs of an acceleration in inflation will likely do little to change market expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates again next month amid worsening trade tensions.

title: Three Reasons Recession Fears Have Suddenly Increased
text: These signs indicate an economic slowdown, but there’s no consensus it will happen.

title: Oil prices drop as data shows surprise climb in US inventories
text: Oil prices fell on Wednesday after industry data showed U.S. crude inventories unexpectedly rose last week, erasing some gains from the last session that were stoked after Washington said it would delay tariffs on some Chinese goods.

title: Stocks bounce, safe havens retreat as Trump delays China tariff
text: Asian shares joined a global equities rally and safe-haven government bonds pulled back on Wednesday, after Washington  delayed tariffs on some Chinese imports in much-needed relief for markets gripped by political and economic turmoil.

title: Stocks surge as Christmas spared tariff price hikes
text: President Trump once boasted he was “tariff man” — but now wants to play Santa Claus. Christmas came early this year when Trump administration trade officials said they would delay imposing tariffs on a series of popular consumer goods — just in time for the holidays.

title: Asia Pacific stocks trade higher as US announces some tariff delays
text: Stocks in Asia Pacific traded higher Wednesday morning as the U.S. announced a delay in the implementation of tariffs on some Chinese goods.

title: U.S. SEC to consider new guidance on investor use of proxy advisors
text: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Tuesday said it would hold a meeting next week on whether to publish new guidance regarding the responsibilities of investors when relying on so-called proxy advisors.

title: Oil soars near 5% as U.S. delays tariffs on some Chinese goods

title: Which Big Oil & Gas Stock Is the Prettiest Pig at the Carnival?

title: Bitcoin's Risk-Adjusted Returns Superior To S&P 500 And Gold

title: USTR Delaying Tariffs On Phones, Laptops From China

text: The US is to delay imposing 10% tariffs on a number of Chinese products including laptops and phones until December - helping Wall Street shares bounce back after a big sell-off.

title: Predicting the next U.S. recession
text: A protracted trade war between China and the United States, the world's largest economies, and a deteriorating global growth outlook has left investors apprehensive about the end to the longest expansion in American history.

title: Top Hedge Funds Bought And Sold These Stocks In Q2
